clinical_study.brief_title: Inflammatory Genetic Polymorphism and Acute Lung Injury After Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Association Study of Inflammatory Genetic Polymorphism and Acute Lung Injury After Cardiac Surgery With Cardiopulmonary Bypass

brief_summary.textblock: Acute lung injury is a common complication of cardiac surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass, and it is significantly related to prolonged postoperative recovery, hospital stays and medical cost. Currently available predictors of acute lung injury after cardiac surgery are still limited within clinical data. Several genetic polymorphism of inflammatory mediators have been reported to be associated with severity of sepsis and ARDS, but the association of these inflammatory polymorphism and acute lung injury after cardiac surgery has never been reported. This study is performed to investigate the association of genetic polymorphisms including TNF -308A/G, IL-10 -1082A/G and IL-6 -572C/G and postoperative lung injury.

primary_outcome.measure: Acute lung injury after cardiac surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass

secondary_outcome.measure: circulating level of CRP, TNF-alpha, IL-10, IL-6; APACHE Ⅱ score; postoperative kidney injury, duration of ventilation, ICU stay and hospitalization; death in 28 days

arm_group.description: patients with acute lung injury at 24h after cardiac surgery
patients without acute lung injury 24h after cardiac surgery

biospec_descr.textblock: 3ml blood before surgery, after surgery and 24h after surgery respectively

study_pop.textblock: Unrelated Chinese Han patients undergoing elective cardiac surgery with CPB

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chinese Han unrelated population
- adult patients
- undergoing elective cardiac surgery with CPB
Exclusion Criteria:
- malignant tumor
- autoimmune disease, immunodeficiency or immunosuppressive therapy
- chronic renal disease (glomerular filtration rate < 60ml/(min•1.73m2)) or liver dysfunction (Child Pugh classification>A)
- COPD, tuberculosis or other chronic pulmonary diseases
- anemia with hemoglobin lower than 90mmHg
- bleeding disorders
- postoperative pericardial tamponade requiring re-operation
- postoperative low cardiac output syndrome or acute pulmonary edema after left cardiac failure.
